content.question: Which of the following best explains the significance of the kaiserâ€™s dispute with the Reichstag as expressed in the passage?

choices.label: The German states had traditionally been governed as constitutional monarchies and were resistant to the imposition of absolutist rule by the kaiser.
Bismarck had used the rhetoric and forms of democracy to unify Germany despite his own autocratic tendencies, leading to the influence of mass politics on German policies.
Socialist and other radical German parties rejected the influence of nationalism in their politics, breaking with German traditions.
The kaiser wished to emulate the system of government in Great Britain under his grandmother Queen Victoria, where Parliament held most of the political power.

content.answer: Bismarck had used the rhetoric and forms of democracy to unify Germany despite his own autocratic tendencies, leading to the influence of mass politics on German policies.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain the significance of a source's point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience, including how these might limit the use(s) of a source.
